greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number T(n,k) of k up, k down permutations of [n]; triangle T(n,k), n>=0, 0<=k<=n, read by rows.
comment: T(n,k) is defined for n,k >= 0.  The triangle contains only the terms with k<=n. T(n,k) = T(n,n) = A000012(n) = 1 for k>n.
link: Alois P. Heinz, Rows n = 0..140, flattened
maple: b:= proc(u, o, t, k) option remember; `if`(u+o=0, 1, add(`if`(t=k,
mathematica: b[u_, o_, t_, k_] := b[u, o, t, k] = If[u+o == 0, 1, Sum[If[t == k, b[o-j, u+j-1, 1, k], b[u+j-1, o-j, t+1, k]], {j, 1, o}]]; t[n_, k_] := If[k+1 >= n, 1, If[k == 0, 0, b[0, n, 0, k]]]; Table[Table[t[n, k], {k, 0, n}], {n, 0, 10}] // Flatten (* _Jean-François Alcover_, Dec 17 2013, translated from Maple *)
results.author: _Alois P. Heinz_, Oct 02 2013
